::: {.unit-reading}
# Reading

## Official Documentation

The definitive resource for Quarto is the [Quarto website](https://quarto.org), which is an ever-increasing, well-maintained place to find tutorials, examples, and an extensive feature reference. It is the go-to resource for comprehensive details about using Quarto effectively.


## Quarto Gallery

For inspiration, or if you know what you want but don't know the technical term, the [Quarto Gallery](https://quarto.org/docs/gallery/) showcases a variety of documents, presentations, websites, and books created with Quarto. Each example includes source files to help you learn by example.

## Community Resources

The [Awsome Quarto](https://github.com/mcanouil/awesome-quarto) repository on GitHub is a curated list of Quarto-related resources, including tutorials, templates, and tools contributed by the community. It's a great way to discover new ways to use Quarto.


## Community Support

Since Quarto is widely used, there is a lot of information available from the community. The [Quarto discussion section on GitHub](https://github.com/orgs/quarto-dev/discussions) is useful for all kinds of questions, including more advanced technical ones. The Quarto developers are active there.

::: 
<!-- end unit-reading div -->

::: {.unit-exercise}
# Practice

### Practice Exercise

Explore the official Quarto documentation and locate the information about customizing output formats. Bookmark or note down key sections.

### Substantial Exercise

Visit the Quarto Examples Gallery, select a detailed example relevant to your interests, and download its source code. Study and customize the example document by altering the parameters, content, or formatting. Render your customized version and submit your modified `.qmd` file, the rendered output, and a brief explanation of your modifications and learning experience.

::: 
<!-- end unit-exercise div -->
